alternative_title: Employers' tax and reporting for bank charges
body:
$!As an employer, reimbursing or paying your employees' bank charges counts as earnings.$!

You will need to:

- add the payments to your employee’s other earnings
- deduct and pay PAYE tax and Class 1 National Insurance through payroll

##What's exempt

If your employees' bank charges are your fault (eg because you paid their wages late) and you pay or reimburse them, this doesn't count as earnings.

You won't need report anything to HMRC or pay any tax or National Insurance.

##Technical guidance

The following guides contain more detailed information:

- [employment income: bank charges](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/eimanual/eim01010.htm "Employment income: bank charges"){:rel="external"}
- [Class 1 National Insurance: bank charges](http://www.hmrc.gov.uk/manuals/nimmanual/NIM02067.htm "Class 1 National Insurance: bank charges"){:rel="external"}
